title: Boards Moderation Team
body: You say you don't mind feedback, criticism, and even offering advice to help others improve but when someone does it it gets misconstrued and because "society" is too fluffy and sensitive... what you ask for is VERY HYPOCRITICAL.  You removed one of my comments because I did EXACTLY this.. and the person was too fluffy to handle the truth.  I didn't disrespect, make up anything, verbally abuse or attack them or any family member, or any such stupid non-sense thing.  Stated fact is all I did... (something similar not verbatim), "my responses were above his intelligence and hopefully one day he would be able to increase his I.Q. to be able to understand the post."  If this is considered what you have ACCUSED me of doing then yeah our generation is hopeless to the hard dealings in the "real world".  Too sensitive to accept criticism or feedback and too closed-minded to understand anything else......

replies.body:
> "my responses were above his intelligence and hopefully one day he would be able to increase his I.Q. to be able to understand the post."

So, basically, you called someone stupid while doing a reddit.com/r/iamverysmart and somehow didn't think that violated the Universal Rules?

Basically, I stated fact.... nothing stupid or idiot about it.... NO ONE is a genius...we all learn... I was stating that my responses were above his intelligence and hoped that one day he evolved to learn what it really means.  Many things I have gone through in life, whether first-hand experience OR being guided through words, texts, pings, etc. leads to the same things but ONLY if one "chooses" it and that is to simply evolve, learn.   Doesn't mean I called someone an idiot because he hasn't got there yet.

That seems to be a very flowery way of calling someone an idiot or stupid.

You know what would have delivered the message better? 

>This concept might be difficult for you to understand with the variance in experience we have.

"This concept might be difficult for you to understand with the variance in experience we have."

this is a flowery way of calling someone an idiot or stupid, to me anyways...."you said it better" (I guess), but still called someone beneath you or an idiot or stupid, especially using big words like "concept" and "variance" which could have equivocal meanings or outcomes...

And you could easily replace those words with "idea" and "difference" .

Your original statement is more direct and does effectively call someone stupid. Mine just suggests we have different experiences and therefore opinions/ideas.

As an example; some people seem to think that trolling/intentional feeding don't exist in norms because they are norms. There are two ways I can approach the discussion:

>Of course there is trolls and int feeding in norms you moron. Don't act like an elitists just because you only grind rank like a sweaty tryhard. It's stupid to think trolls/inters exist in only ranked.

-_-

>Occasionally I get trolls or inters in a normal match and it is just as unfun as it would be in ranked. I get that it sucks a bit more in ranked because of the lp factor. Saying they don't exist in other modes would be unfair though.

Can't replace something if I was banned for one... replacing would be part of learning process... do something wrong... correct the situation.... my ENTIRE complaint has been that another persons harassment since the beginning of match caused my feelings to stir, "just like someone was beating your loved one in front of you", and I was banned for standing up.... Just like "I would HOPE" you would try and stop the person from beating your loved one RIGHT in front of you.  But instead of seeing, reason, logic, and fact.. I have been given cop out answers.... his actions don't excuse your own....

> because "society" is too fluffy and sensitive

I feel this is one of those things that is too much of a personal opinion to discuss properly. 

As far as moderation goes, you may attack a person's argument as vigorously as you like. What you may not do is insult a person, regardless of how obliquely or how "fluffy and sensitive" you make it.

as we all should have our own personal opinions... these "opinions" doesn't change fact..  losers in tournaments are given trophies because we, as a society, are afraid to hurt kids feelings, this is a small example.  To discuss it "properly", well that's an entirely different story, viewpoint, and care level, so we do agree on that. =)

Well, my last removal says you're lying. 

"Specialist at work here guys. I can only imagine the rigorous screening process is takes to earn such a title. You probably need a 90% downvote rate on all your posts and to be on your knees defending Riot no matter what they do."

None of this targets the person as an individual, but rather the content of his posts.
